title: Re: Something New From Blizzard
content:
It looks good, and the new features sound intriguing. I'm cautiously optimistic. I've downloaded the trailer, and shall observe upon awakening. Let's hope they do the Starcraft name justice, unlike what I've seen of modern (post-2000) Quake, UT and C&C games.

Still, I'm glad they haven't abandoned Starcraft. At least it's still Blizzard creating it, rather than some no-name spinoff company. News of this sequel means almost as much as an announcement of Tom Hall creating TUIT.

title: Re: Something New From Blizzard
content: Or Duke Nukem Forever being released.

title: Re: Something New From Blizzard
content: Indeed, that's a more accurate comparison.

title: Re: Something New From Blizzard
content:
Woah... that black hole thing kinda freaked me out. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

It looks like this is one of the FEW games that is going to be a TRUE sequel. Maybe I was too hasty to say it was more of the same...

It all depends on how they do it. For example... let us select an INFINITE number of units PLEASE! I mean putting a limit on units was a GREAT idea back in the dos days of Warcraft with keeping memory in check... it doesn't make any sense now though. (And makes having more than one base impossible.)-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Something New From Blizzard
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I really don't get what all the fuss is about here? All forums I go to are going crazy about this.[hr][/quote]
This is just one of the most anticipated games ever. It's like if TUIT, Duke Nukem Forever, Fallout 3, Descent or Thief 4, or another System Shock game were released.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: Something New From Blizzard
content:
Well vince, if you were a huge starcraft fan, you'd probably be going nuts about it haha. Imagine if Tom release TUIT. That's how all sc fans out there feel right now.

The graphics may feel weird right now, but that's what everyone said about wc3 graphics. It just takes time to get used to.
However, they did handicap wc3 by one thing. Wc3 was much slower paced than wc2 was. But judging by the screenshots, it looks like the 200 food limit from sc1 still exists.

title: well...
content:
Blizzard's got a 450mb download of a high-res movie showcasing some gameplay with a lot of staged action demonstrating new Protoss units... worth the download, just to see how things animate.

While I was never a fan of Starcraft, I appreciate its impact on the gaming world, and respect it for the juggernaut it is.

title: Re: well...
content: Ooh, the gameplay trailer is finally available on that site. Got the 1280 version downloading now (gotta use a torrent from Demonoid since that stupid Blizzard downloader sucks).
